frontmatter.title: Compute Demo: Use Rooki to access CMIP6 data

affiliations.name: NSF National Center for Atmospheric Research

children.value: is a Python client to interact with
data subsetting service for climate model data. This service is used in the backend by the

to access the CMIP6 data pool. The Rook service is deployed for load-balancing at IPSL (Paris) and DKRZ (Hamburg). The CMIP6 data pool is shared with ESGF. The provided CMIP6 subset for Copernicus is synchronized at both sites.
to retrieve a subset of the CMIP6 data pool. These operators are implemented by the
Python libray and are based on
library is developed by Ouranos (Canada), CEDA (UK) and DKRZ (Germany).
The operators can be called remotly using the

import os

# Configuration line to set the wps node - in this case, use DKRZ in Germany
os.environ['ROOK_URL'] = 'http://rook.dkrz.de/wps'

from rooki import rooki
The CMIP6 dataset is identified by a dataset-id. An intake catalog as available to lookup the available datasets:

children.value:
A provenance document is generated remotely to document the operation steps.
The provenance uses the
Run workflow with subset and average operator

children.label: Run workflow with subset and average operator

children.value: Instead of running a single operator one can also chain several operators in a workflow.
Use rooki operators to create a workflow

children.label: Use rooki operators to create a workflow

children.value: from rooki import operators as ops
... internally the workflow tree is a json document

tas = ops.Input(
    'tas', ['c3s-cmip6.CMIP.MPI-M.MPI-ESM1-2-HR.historical.r1i1p1f1.Amon.tas.gn.v20190710']
)

wf = ops.Subset(
    tas, 
    time="2000/2000",
    time_components="month:jan,feb,mar",
    area='-30,-40,70,80',  
)

wf = ops.WeightedAverage(wf)
Optional: look at the workflow json document

children.label: Optional: look at the workflow json document

children.value: In this notebook, we used the Rooki Python client to retrieve a subset of a CMIP6 dataset. The operations are executed remotely on a Rook subsetting service (using OGC API and xarray/clisops). The dataset is plotted and a provenance document is shown. We also showed that remote operators can be chained to be executed in a single workflow operation.
This service is used by the European Copernicus Climate Data Store.
We need to figure out how this service can be used in the new ESGF:
how can it be integrated in the ESGF search (STAC catalogs, ...)
